Package view

Class EditTicketScreen

java.lang.Object
view.EditTicketScreen
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActionListener, EventListener
public class EditTicketScreen extends Object implements ActionListener
This class is responsible for the screen that allows us to create a new ticket or edit an existing ticket. It also provides the option to go back to the previous screen that lists all the tickets of a specific itinerary.
Author:
Gabriel Fernando

  • Method Details

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent ae)
      This method is responsible for identifying whether the "back", "Create", or "Update" buttons have been clicked. Before the "Create" and "Update" operations are performed, it calls the ticket controller to validate the data.
      Specified by:
      actionPerformed in interface ActionListener
      Parameters:
      ae - the event captured by the ActionListener

    • goBack

      public JButton goBack(JButton goBackButton, String text)
      Configures a goBackButton button with the provided text and custom styling, underlining the button when the mouse cursor hovers over it and returning to normal when the mouse moves away.
      Parameters:
      goBackButton - the back button to be configured
      text - the text to be displayed on the button
      Returns:
      the configured button

    • button

      public JButton button(JButton button, String text)
      Configures a button with the provided text and custom styling settings, which changes the background color of the button when the mouse cursor hovers over it, and restores the original color when the mouse moves away.
      Parameters:
      button - the button to be configured
      text - the text to be displayed on the button
      Returns:
      the configured button

    • getWindowValues

      public void getWindowValues()
      Method responsible for retrieving the values of price, seat type, and seat number that are provided as input on the edit screen

    • mensagemErroCadastro

      public void mensagemErroCadastro(int error)
      This method is responsible for displaying an error message screen, indicating that the provided values are not valid. The possible error types can include: empty field, negative number, null value, and field with a non-numeric value.
      Parameters:
      error - the error identification number

    • mensagemSucessoAtualizar

      public void mensagemSucessoAtualizar(int i)
      This method notifies that the process of updating a ticket at index i in the database's ticket list has been completed.
      Parameters:
      i - the index of the updated ticket

    • mensagemSucessoCriar

      public void mensagemSucessoCriar()
      This method displays a message that communicates the completion of the ticket creation process
